sentence.Network_en: The media has made unfeeling voyeurs of all of us.
sentence.Network_cn: 媒体把我们所有人都变成了无情刺探他人隐私的人。

sentence.Network_en: What a cold, unfeeling woman she was.
sentence.Network_cn: 她真是个冷酷无情的女人！

sentence.Network_en: He was branded an unfeeling bully.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English unfēlende 'insensible' (see un-, feeling)

entry.def: If you describe someone as unfeeling, you are criticizing them for their lack of kindness or sympathy for other people.

example.ex: He was branded an unfeeling bully...
There's no way anyone could accuse this woman of being cold and unfeeling...
example.tran: 谁都不能指责这个女人冷血无情。

auth_sentence.content: I didn't want the company to seem unfeeling.
auth_sentence.res_content: I didn't want the company to seem unfeeling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I didn't want the company to seem unfeeling.

auth_sentence.content: He wasn't an unfeeling technocrat, though.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He wasn't an unfeeling technocrat, though.

auth_sentence.content: I was offended by the unfeeling normality of the milkman delivering and the sun rising.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was offended by the unfeeling normality of the milkman delivering and the sun rising.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was offended by the unfeeling normality of the milkman delivering and the sun rising.

sentences.en: What she saw was just an unfeeling corpse.
sentences.cn: 她见到的只是一具全无感觉的尸体。

means.word_mean: 无情的,硬心肠的;无同情心的

sentences.en: He is hard and unfeeling towards his children.
sentences.cn: 他对自己的孩子严厉无情。
